intro: Acridocarpus ledermannii, commonly known as the Ledermann's hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are ovate and have a rough texture, while the flowers are usually pink or red in color. Acridocarpus ledermannii is adapted to tropical climates and thrives in well-drained soils.
